item.title: Getting started with the `tmerge` function in the `survival` package
item.dc:creator: Maximilian Rohde
item.description: The `tmerge` function is used to structure data to represent time-dependent variables in a survival analysis. The post shows a minimal example of how to use `tmerge`.

item.title: Sensitivity of odds-ratios calculated on dichotomized variables to inclusion criteria
item.dc:creator: Maximilian Rohde
item.description: A short simulation example showing why dichomization of continuous variables can lead to wrong conclusions.

item.title: Creating a bookdown book with the bs4 theme
item.dc:creator: Maximilian Rohde
item.description: A short guide to creating a bookdown book using the bs4 theme

item.title: What is Gradient Descent? (Part I)
item.dc:creator: Maximilian Rohde
item.description: Exploring gradient descent using R and a minimal amount of mathematics

item.title: Statistical simulation of robust estimators with tidyverse tools
item.dc:creator: Maximilian Rohde
item.description: Tidyverse tools provide a powerful way to do statistical simulations. We demonstrate this approach by evaluating the properties of the mean and median as estimators of center for two distributions.
